headline: GM Is Cutting More Than 1,200 Jobs. Blame EVs.
summary: General Motors  said Wednesday it will lay off 1,200 workers at its electric-vehicle plant near Detroit, along with hundreds of other employees.  “In response to slower near-term EV adoption and an evolving regulatory environment, General Motors is realigning EV capacity,” the company said in an emailed statement.  “Despite these changes, GM remains committed to our U.S. manufacturing footprint, and we believe our investments and dedication to flexible operations will make GM more resilient and capable of leading through change.”

content.title: GM Is Cutting More Than 1,200 Jobs. Blame EVs.
content.summary: General Motors  said Wednesday it will lay off 1,200 workers at its electric-vehicle plant near Detroit, along with hundreds of other employees.  “In response to slower near-term EV adoption and an evolving regulatory environment, General Motors is realigning EV capacity,” the company said in an emailed statement.  “Despite these changes, GM remains committed to our U.S. manufacturing footprint, and we believe our investments and dedication to flexible operations will make GM more resilient and capable of leading through change.”

headline: GM lays off 1,700 workers at plants in Michigan and Ohio amid slower EV demand
summary: General Motors is laying off about 1,700 workers across manufacturing sites in Michigan and Ohio, as the auto giant adjusts to slowing demand for electric vehicles.  The Detroit News first reported the cuts on Wednesday — covering about 1,200 jobs at an all-electric plant in the Detroit area and 550 workers at Ultium Cells battery cell plant in Ohio, in addition to hundreds of other employees slated for temporary layoffs.

content.title: GM lays off 1,700 workers at plants in Michigan and Ohio amid slower EV demand
content.summary: General Motors is laying off about 1,700 workers across manufacturing sites in Michigan and Ohio, as the auto giant adjusts to slowing demand for electric vehicles.  The Detroit News first reported the cuts on Wednesday — covering about 1,200 jobs at an all-electric plant in the Detroit area and 550 workers at Ultium Cells battery cell plant in Ohio, in addition to hundreds of other employees slated for temporary layoffs.

headline: GM to lay off 3,300 workers building EVs and batteries as demand slows
summary: GM is dropping one of two daily shifts at the end of the year at Factory Zero, a person with knowledge of the production plans told Automotive News.

content.title: GM to lay off 3,300 workers building EVs and batteries as demand slows
content.summary: GM is dropping one of two daily shifts at the end of the year at Factory Zero, a person with knowledge of the production plans told Automotive News.

thumbnail.caption: General Motors will idle production at the Factory Zero electric vehicle assembly plant in Detroit until Nov. 24 before converting to a single shift in January. The plant builds the Chevrolet Silverado EV and GMC Sierra EV pickups, the GMC Hummer EV pickup and SUV, and the Cadillac Escalade IQ SUV.

headline: Explainer-Why Nexperia is at the centre of an autos chip crisis
summary: AMSTERDAM (Reuters) -A standoff between the Netherlands and China over chipmaker Nexperia has sparked a near crisis for global carmakers that has threatened production, laying bare supply chain risks.  The fight hit the headlines over fears about technology transfer from the Dutch company to its Chinese parent Wingtech, amid rising scrutiny on global tech from the administration of U.S. President Donald Trump.  WHAT IS NEXPERIA?

content.title: Explainer-Why Nexperia is at the centre of an autos chip crisis
content.summary: AMSTERDAM (Reuters) -A standoff between the Netherlands and China over chipmaker Nexperia has sparked a near crisis for global carmakers that has threatened production, laying bare supply chain risks.  The fight hit the headlines over fears about technology transfer from the Dutch company to its Chinese parent Wingtech, amid rising scrutiny on global tech from the administration of U.S. President Donald Trump.  WHAT IS NEXPERIA?
